comments.body: This is a great idea; in fact, I made an account just to make this suggestion! One thing I’d like to add on to this is the concept of a new villager type that buys and sells firework related items such as gunpowder, paper, or even creeper heads and some pre-made rockets.

Couldn't agree more. Considering the amount of variation for fireworks that is available in Minecraft, there simply needs to be a better way to craft them. Fireworks aren't used nearly as much as they would be if the process was made easier. It's a little absurd that it is no easier to make fireworks in creative mode than it is in survival. This is a very overlooked aspect of the game and needs some love.
My grammar sucks lol
its fine lol i have bad grammar too Xd
but what will happen if you want to get the ingots from the iron?
I do trust you.
@SpringyToast735 You would still get normal iron ingots as oxidization is only on the surface of metals.
Similar to how Lapis used to be Fools Diamond, Rusted Iron could be Fools Copper, as I imagine it would look similar. Weathered Copper on the other hand could possibly be confused with emeralds?
But, Rusted Iron could be used to create "copper" items and blocks that don't exist, such as Copper Bars (Rusted Iron Bars) and Copper Tools
I was thinking the same thing but when you have rusty Iron tools, the durability is lowered and when you attack, it gives a debuff effect similar to poison (tetanus, caused by rusty metal)
This is an AMAZING idea.
Can this coal be fought in early steps of game ?
That’s a great idea and not to mention deepstate coal is now much rarer so what if we add deepstate variants of anthracite too in 1.18 snapshot or 1.19
The anthracite blocks would be cool
1. And should be made with a toaster that’s made with iron at the bottom 6 and the top 3 stone slaps
Good idea but not 3 or 4 hearts but 3 or 4 hunger bars
It could also be a new combat mechanic. Maybe sprinting into something could damage it and give it huge knockback. I would love more unique armor options like this that allows for more customization.
sounds epic
Well, they just added the ramming mechanic.

Goat horn and leather helmet in the crafting table gives you Horned leather helmet
which when hitting a player or a mob while sprinting gives a little damage and a knockback
And a goat master potion would be cool
on block
It's durability should be between iron and diamond. And you should have to craft it like netherite but with iron instead of gold.

I dislike the concept of an ore that would have similar stats/specs to Diamond, but I agree with an idea of adding a new ore to the Ender World.

Also the "but with a 50% chance of doing 1 more damage" seems awkward to me.

Instead, I would like to suggest adding an ore to the End, which is not a material of real life but an ore based with 'Magic' of Minecraft.

In my opinion, Mojang developing further for magic would be fine and not have dispute of chemical and physical aspects of real materials. (somewhat like redstone)
it should be like real titanium, light-weight and strong
Maybe you could craft arrows with glow ink from the glow squid.

You read my mind. I think it would be good to add glow shards into the game (glow stones when mined will give glow shards instead of glow dust. Those shards would be later processed into dust  that we know or recombined into glow stones) Glow shards could be used in place of flint to craft glowing arrows
One possibility I think is to make crossbows fire some light source when the light is held in your off hand just like with firework rockets.

Or we could just have the minecraft equivalent of lasers and have light sources that emit light very far in a specific direction, kind of like the beacon. These light sources would only extend very far in one direction (the distance depending on the crafting recipe), wouldn't have any range in the opposite direction, and would only have like a block of range around it in the remaining four directions.
I am a builder and i use blocks for designs and i dont want it to change. There should be blocks with Each level like anvils and a way to turn deterioration off.

Besides the 2×1 plants, pumpkins and watermelons and tall cacti could be placed in them.
They could also have color variations, and an ordinary large pot could be a Gardener Villager workstation block.
It would be great if you could put rose bushes in a plant pot!
Eso no presenta ningún sentido
It should be pronounced joo-sha
Come on guy's! This will be good for everyone! A totaly logic and simple idea that will give more logic and fun to the game and for the player's!
I once accidentally threw my netherite boots to a creeper and they blew up, so this would be logical

I'm sure this would mean that cheaters could easily get minecoins for free.

If you are looking for a way to acquire minecoins without paying money maybe take a look at https://account.microsoft.com/rewards/ instead, the redeemable prices include store gift cards which can be used to purchase minecoin.
People could just go into creative mode, place a bunch of the ore, go into survival mode, mine a bunch of it, and repeat it. This would just give them free money.
It shouldnt work with cheats on
You should get6 minecoins with fortune enchantment also you would nee an iron to netherite pickaxe
This ore cannot be silktouched. It has no item form.
This would be useful, and it also makes sense since gold armour is the easiest to enchant.

I think it should apply blindness for a very brief moment, but that just my opinion even though it could be a bit op. Great idea either way.

Good idea. But to ensure the mystery of Minecraft lore remains relatively unchanged, the books could be old and worn, missing some letters and/or words. Or better yet, they could be written in the enchanting and illager fonts.
